ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot more than I expected about book design. I learned how to discern subtleties between typefaces, how to think more rigorously about choosing typefaces, and how to design at drastically different scales. I also learned how to iterate quite a bit, and most enjoyed when we were tasked with wider experimentation before narrowing in on a particular direction. I will be taking that approach with me into my future work. I also learned quite a bit about purposeful communication, and how the different mediums we were designing for communicated in particular ways. A lot of my learning came out of the critique time, seeing how others responded to work, and learning how to look and verbalize what I saw.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish the crits would have been together with the grads!

This course was excellent at teaching us a few possible strategies for the process behind creating work and iterating on work. I appreciated how the assignments spanned a broad range of forms, and how slowly (slowly) the course went in relation to our other courses . . . the opportunity to build up a body of work around a topic was unlike most other things we were doing this semester. The timing of the projects was also spot on, wouldnt change a thing about that.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely. The course is thoughtfully constructed, and Julian is an incredibly engaged teacher. Would recommend any course he teaches. This one in particular is quite good at teaching how to design content across mediums, and has provided a useful way to think about design moving forward in ones own practice.

extras.title: ART 468 01 - Ad Hoc Series and Systems
